text:
<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased API Error Rates>
We are investigating increased API error rates in the US-EAST-1 Region.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased API Error Rates>
We continue to investigate increased API error rates in the US-EAST-1 Region.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Service degradation: Increased API Error Rates>
We have identified the root cause of the increased API error rates in the US-EAST-1 Region. We continue to work toward resolution.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased API Error Rates>
We are beginning to see recovery for the increased API error rates in the US-EAST-1 Region. We continue to work toward full recovery.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Change Propagation Delays>
Weâ€™re investigating longer than usual propagation times for changes to CloudFront configurations. End-user requests for content from our edge locations are not affected by this issue and are being served normally.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Increased API Error Rates>
Between 8:41 AM and 11:10 AM PDT we experienced increased API error rates in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Change Propagation Delays>
We have identified the root cause of the longer than usual propagation times for changes to CloudFront configurations. We continue to work toward resolution.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Change Propagation Delays>
Between 8:50 AM and 12:59 PM PDT, we experienced longer than usual propagation times for changes to CloudFront configurations. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
